mdRecord.dcterms:title: Biology bat watch at Beaver Creek
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Shurtleff, Andrew
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Bat detector in hand, associate professor of biology Kate Jones, above in foreground, leads a bat watch recently at Beaver Creek Park in Ivy. About 40 people attended the watch and had between five and ten bat sightings using the detector, which picks up high frequency bat calls, similar to sonar, emitted during feeding.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Visual History Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: University of Virginia
University of Virginia. News Office--Press coverage
